title.narrative: OP 3.3: PARTICIPATION

description.narrative: Children and adolescents participate in decision- making processes which affect their interest, which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development (Covid), Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, society's commitment to respect and promote child rights in Uruguay strengthened

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Children and adolescents participate in decision- making processes which affect their interest

description.narrative: In line with the Generation Unlimited objectives, one of UNICEF Uruguay office’s lines of work with adolescents sought to empower young people to implement innovative solutions to the challenges they encounter in their communities. UNICEF continued the work it started in 2019 to promote anInnovation Competitionfor adolescents and young people. Another line of work was the Sumá tu voz [Add your voice] strategy to promote participation. This programme brought together young people from different backgrounds and areas of the country to discuss their rights, issues that affect them and outlooks for the future, and to share their views. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/01/2021

Existence of a multi-sectoral, adolescent policy/action plan (reflecting sectoral commitments for adolescents)

actual.value: 2020:ExistsThere is a national, multi-sectoral action plan for children and adolescents (see link). It considers adolescents from the age of 12 up to and including 17. The institutions that participate are: the President's office, the National Institute for C
